 A Generic Buffer Manager : EventBufferManager EventBufferManager is an implementation of a buffer manager for tracing:

template<class T >

Detailed Description

Based on Inuktitut� INRIA Recorder.

Author:
J. Briat, T. Gautier This file is dedicated to the buffer and event recording management classes. First version appears in Inuktitut� INRIA tracing facility. This class implement a mechanism. All event are completely recorded in a buffer. When buffer cannot hold an effet, the buffer is flushed in a trace file and a fresh buffer is used for the event. When flushing a buffer, a flush event record is inserted in the new buffer. This will be used to trace the behavior of the buffer allocation strategy.

Recording of value is done by memory block copy in the buffer using the templated operator <<. This template must be specialized for specific needs. This is the case for the std::string type.

This part is environnement dependant and must be adapted as needed.
